media:group.media:title: SVM with polynomial kernel visualization (HD)
media:group.media:description:
NOTE: This is a new version in HD of my video from 2007. A brand new video is expected in next month.

A visual demonstration of the kernel trick in SVM.

This short video demonstrates how vectors of two classes that cannot be linearly separated in 2-D space, 
can become linearly separated by a transformation function into a higher
dimensional space.

The transformation used is:
f([x y]) = [x y (x^2+y^2)]

Visit my homepage https://www.udiprod.com/
